result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas D Cermak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to Jail (Felony), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1r)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**Amended 5/14/18 to indicate the defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: to 13CF156.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall establish and maintain full-time employment.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall not go upon any premises where he has cause to believe such contraband may be present.

Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall establish and maintain a stable residence.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
